If you enjoy the first 2 bioshock games, you will not like infinite.

When I first got this game (I pre-ordered it), I played it three times in a row. I love the game so much, once wasn't enough. I went back and played it again doing a few different things while also trying to figure out what the ending meant. The gameplay is superb and the voice acting is amazing. The story.. THE STORY. It's so amazing. I loved every second of this game and I have actually, since my initial playthroughs, I beat it two more times and then played all the DLC. 
All of the DLC are amazing too and I loved playing all of those. I really liked Burial At Sea, but honestly, the main story is a lot better than any of the DLC were.

This gmae is gr8, You do not need any of the other titles to play this one, its very split off from the first 2.
The graphics hold up very very well. It runs soo well and looks good, the gamplay is so fun and there are very awesome abilitys to use. its like magic. [spoiler] there is a super crazy story and ending, and I still dont even realy get it completely. [/spoiler] There is such a strong lore behind this game ~9.11/10~

å¥½æ¸¸æˆï¼Œä½†æ˜¯ï¼Œè¯¥æ­»çš„3Dæ™•çœ©ç—‡ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚

I was totally excited for the city-in-the-sky Columbia environments and anxious to experience the crazy story after loving BS1 and mostly enjoying BS2 (though the latter was too long and lacked gamepad controls)... but Infinite demonstrates that the series has devolved into what's been widely derided as a hallway shooter. It's an extraordinarily nice hallway, which houses beautiful art design, deeply disturbed characters, and a strange twisting story. But after playing through, those feel like they exist to mask the severe lack of good gameplay and player choices.

Kudos to Irrational games for creating a genuinely novel game setting and working to advance the medium, but for every step forward here there is an equally major step backward. If you enjoy FPS titles, you'll be totally underwhelmed by the weapons and combat; if you enjoy puzzles you won't be challenged; if you enjoy RPGs you'll be thoroughly disappointed by the lack of choices; and if you like stealth, well they based the the final DLC around stealth but it's a frustrating mess that could only be suffered by masochists.

The art, level design, and voice acting are fantastic, so in that sense it's still quite an adventure... an extremely linear adventure. Y'know, like a movie, except occasionally interrupted by backtracking or restarting the last 20 minutes of your session.

So go watch someone else play though Bioshock Infinite and you'll squeeze out virtually every ounce of possible enjoyment. The developers didn't actually include any good reason to play it for yourself.

I play a lot of games and this is my favorite game of all times.

Bioshock Infinite is one of those games where you start playing and you quickly lose track of time because of how much you enjoy the game.

+ The gameplay is fantastic, you several special abilities (Vigor's) to use as well as an assortment of weapons to switch between that doesn't get boring
+ Skyhooking everywhere is fun
+ The plot is amazing and captivating, and the ending will leave you in a stupor much like Inception
+ The character developement is awesome, between Booker, the Twins, Elizabeth <3, and even Comstock, the game does an amazing job of getting you to like and hate certain characters
+ Imagine you're playing kill the Westboro Baptist Church members simulator

I wanted to play it again after I played through the rest of the Bioshock family in order like my friends recommend, but I eventually got too lazy and distracted as other games came out, but I definitely regret not going back and doing that.

No doubt you're no stranger to the BioShock series. Great atmosphere, great storylines, and great voice acting. You know all this. For me, it's not all perfect, though it is great. All the BioShock games have roughly the same combat system, and I have never liked it.

There are very few games I play for the story, but this is one of them. I've heard that some people find the combat fun, but I do not. The reason is simple: I play everything on the hardest difficulty from the beginning, but BioShock simply raises enemy health and damage, which is frustrating. If you play on lower levels of difficulty, it's too easy, but higher levels require more bullets and more spells rather than more skill. Any combat system that requires more than one headshot to kill a human enemy is a combat system I will not enjoy.

Even so, it's easy to recommend any of the BioShock games, just don't bother raising the difficulty.

This is one of the greatest game ever made. A complex, multilayered story that will likely take multiple replays and videos to truly understand everything that happens, characters that are lovable and get you emotionally invested in them, an art direction so gorgeous that it reinforces my belief that fantastic art direction trumps photorealistic graphics any day, great combat system that encourages switching up weapons all the time and experimenting with different vigor combos, and phenomenal soundtrack and voice acting. "Masterpiece" is the only way to accurately describe this game.

This game ripped off stanger things. Elizabeth and Booker will never have a relationship as pure as Eleven and Mike. Mike really became himself again when he reunited with El. Iâ€™ve watched the new season like twice now and it has been out for 3 days. It makes me want to be in the show and I get so sad when I remember that this show is not real life. After I watched it, I actually looked up how to audition for Stranger Things. You never know, they might need new characters for season three! Plus, I love acting. I REALLY hope there is a new season. How can a show be this freaking good??!! When I finished it, I was so shocked and I didnâ€™t want to watch any other show because I know that none of them will amount to how good this show is. Even when I tried to watch another show, I was like, â€œNope, this isnâ€™t Stranger Thingsâ€, and I would shut it off. Stranger Things is - and always will be - my favorite show EVER. Plus, shout-out to all the people who went to the bathroom after this, looked at themselves in the mirror, and pretended to be in the show ğŸ˜‚. Or maybe that was just me. My family is not nearly as obsessed with this show as I am, and no one I talk to seems to really love the show (how can they not???) as much as I do. This show has seriously got me tripped up and I never want it to end. I am literally so emotional about it. Itâ€™s like itâ€™s REAL LIFE, yah know? But when I see all the kids from the show on tv and YouTube videos talking about making Stranger Things, Iâ€™m like, â€œOh, itâ€™s not real, and they donâ€™t actually have those livesâ€ğŸ˜”. Iâ€™m way too obsessed. Props to you if you made it to the end of my comment. No one I know feels the same about this show as I do, but if you do, TALK TO ME!! Tell me what you guys think! Start a convo! Share with me your obsessions and questions because quite frankly, I am DYING to talk to somebody about this show who feels the same about it as I do. Hope you reply!!ï»¿
Awesome Story

Compared to the original Bioshock, this is a much brighter experience. Literally, because you get to be outside much of the time :).
For most of the game, you won't be alone. Your companion, Elizabeth, certainly deserves a separate paragraph. As far as game characters go, she is one of the best I've ever seen. The acting represented by both voice and animation is superb and the character itself is quite deep and interesting.
During your adventure, various weapons and powers (vigors) will be available to you.
Weapon variability is decent, though not staggering. I got the impression that in the end it matters very little what weapons you use (you can only carry two at a time) because they can all become quite powerful through upgrades. I'm not saying a rocket launcher is the same as a sniper rifle, of course. This can be both good and bad. Good because you can choose weapons based on your playstyle (for example machine gun X rifle) and if the two weapons compliment each other well you won't have to change your mind later. Bad because you probably won't have enough money to upgrade more weapons if you do change your mind. But that's a minor thing that you can certainly plan for.
The vigor powers are, well, OK. I ended up using only two or three of the supporting ones. For attacking you're mostly fine using weapons.
The final thing I'd like to mention is the story. Even though it's not very original and doesn't actually make sense :), it's presented is such a way that I didn't really care and thoroughly enjoyed it.
Overall great game, highly recommended.

From start to finish this game is absolutely amazing, from the gameplay to the storyline.

They polished the gameplay a bit in comparison to the first two BioShock games (less backtracking and more satisfying combat) but kept the feeling of a BioShock game. The way the story is told and all the smaller bits you can pick up about it on your own remains great.

The story is (no spoilers) amazing, it reels you in from start and you will not be disappointed at the end.
best game graphic everything cant wait for the new one

Game is definitely overrated. I didnt find me being blown away by the story .its an average fps with limited variety of guns and enemies the multy universe theory and the ending was Lame and not satisfstory. Elizabeth can see through doors of multiple universe. why do they have to go to rapture for that. Rapture wa built in 1930s this is in 1912.

However he graphics and columbia s settings and skyhook maje it worh the money.
6/10

I. . .really can't come to terms with what this game is. 

It's a great game, it's was a good idea and it was carried out brilliantly. I had loads of fun fghting the city and I really enjoyed the game. But, that's not what I walked away with.

I just feel goddamn awful about what happened to Elizabeth. What I've done to her, what she's been put through, watching her excitement and joy and love of life fade with every gunshot- it's a dull pain that grows in you as you play like a tumor. Being put through it is almost as much pain as it is happiness. The excitement and thrill of the game is temporary, but the sadness is enduring.

Find another way to have fun that doesn't leave you wallowing in regret.

As previously mentioned on the boards, BioShock Infinite is a pretty much a poor Call of Duty under a BioShock feat. Georges Washington skin.

There is truly nothing that I will remember from that game aside of the awesome artistic direction and universe, which sold the game to everybody.

In terms of gameplay and level design, Infinite is a linear shooter with traditional guns and ammo - forget the bi-tri gun modes of BioShock first, there is none here - another CoD arsenal. Plasmids are pretty much boring too unless you're one of those hardcore gamers as featured on YouTube which spent hours developing crazy combos. "Linear" means the city isn't explorable as well.

The story, although its plot was predictible since the beginning, is  Infinites' other main attribute next to its art direction. However, coming deep as it is... I consider it a bad story.

The DLC's didn't do it for me. They didn't really bring back my excitement.

The first BioShock remains the only one and you should stick to it.
lo adoro, es PERFECTO
Gran historia, reconmendadisimo al 100%

Ya habia jugado antes BIOSHOCK INFINITE, lo eh terminado 2 veces, que les puedo decir, es una joya de Video Juego Shooter que no podria faltar para nada en tus logros y colecciones, mucha accion, excelentes graficos a pesar de que salio en el 2013 da mucho de que hablar, en fin inicie con este juego y no me arrepiento de comprar BIOSHOCK 1 Y 2 que tambien me encantaron y no dudare en comprar los DLC de este juego en fin gracias por este tipo de aventuras y dificultades.

There are people who complain about the ending to this, and they can do one. I love crazy high concept stuff even if it only just hangs together.

Oh... Yeah... The game. The game's great fun. It's never going to recapture the magic of Bioshock or System Shock 2, but it get pretty close.

To do list for anyone who hasn't played Bioshock:

1. Take a good hard look at your life and ask yourself why you haven't played Bioshock.
2. Buy Bioshock.
3. Play Bioshock.
4. Be completely confused.
5. Play again
6. Fall in love
7. Buy all the merch
8. Realise there's DLC
9. Play DLC
10. Realise there's no more Bioshock
11. Drown your sorrors over on /r/Bioshock
